001package imagingbook.lib.image;
002
003import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
004import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
005import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
006import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
007import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
008
009/**
010 * This class defines methods to perform arbitrary geometric transformations
011 * on images. The geometric transformation (mapping) must be specified at
012 * construction, optionally a pixel interpolation method can be specified.
013 * 
014 * @version 2019/01/04
015 *
016 */
017public class ImageMapper {
018        
019        /** Default pixel interpolation method (see {@link InterpolationMethod}). */
020        public static InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bicubic;     
021        
022        private final InterpolationMethod im;
023        private final Mapping2D mp;
024        
025        /**
026         * Creates a new instance with the specified geometric mapping.
027         * The default pixel interpolation method is used
028         * (see {@link DefaultInterpolationMethod}).
029         * @param mp the geometric mapping
030         */
031        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D mp) {
032                this(mp, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
033        }
034
035        /**
036         * Creates a new instance with the specified geometric mapping
037         * and pixel interpolation method.
038         * @param mp the geometric mapping
039         * @param im the pixel interpolation method
040         */
041        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D mp, InterpolationMethod im) {
042                this.mp = mp;
043                this.im = im;
044        }
045        
046        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
047        
048        /**
049         * Destructively transforms the passed image using this geometric
050         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
051         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
052         * target to source image coordinates!
053         * 
054         * @param ip target image to which this mapping is applied
055         */
056        public void map(ImageProcessor ip) {
057                // make a temporary copy of the image:
058                ImageProcessor source = ip.duplicate();
059                ImageProcessor target = ip;
060                map(source, target);
061                source = null;
062        }
063        
064        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
065        
066        /**
067         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
068         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method. Note that source
069         * and target must be different images!
070         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
071         * target to source image coordinates!
072         * 
073         * @param source input image (not modified)
074         * @param target output image (modified)
075         */
076        public void map(ImageProcessor source, ImageProcessor target) {
077                if (target == source) {
078                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
079                }
080                ImageAccessor sourceAcc = ImageAccessor.create(source, null, im);
081                ImageAccessor targetAcc = ImageAccessor.create(target);
082                map(sourceAcc, targetAcc);
083        }
084
085        
086        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
087
088        /**
089         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
090         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
091         * The two images are passed as instances of {@link ImageAccessor}.
092         * Note that source and target reference different images!
093         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
094         * target to source image coordinates!
095         * 
096         * @param sourceAcc accessor to the source image
097         * @param targetAcc accessor to the target image
098         */
099        public void map(ImageAccessor sourceAcc, ImageAccessor targetAcc) {
100                if (targetAcc.getProcessor() == sourceAcc.getProcessor()) {
101                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
102                }
103                Mapping2D invMap = mp;          // this always IS an inverse mapping!!
104                ImageProcessor target = targetAcc.getProcessor();
105                final int w = target.getWidth();
106                final int h = target.getHeight();
107                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
108                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
109                                Pnt2d sourcePt = invMap.applyTo(PntInt.from(u, v));
110                                float[] val = sourceAcc.getPix(sourcePt.getX(), sourcePt.getY());
111                                targetAcc.setPix(u, v, val);
112                        }
113                }
114        }
115
116}
